channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Obama says White House response to coronavirus has been 'absolute chaotic disaster'
item.description: Former President Barack Obama delivered a blistering critique of the Trump administration's response to the coronavirus crisis, describing it as "an absolute chaotic disaster" during a private call Friday night with people who worked for him in the White House and across his administration.

item.title: Allies despair as Trump abandons America's leadership role at a time of global crisis
item.description: The United States has scaled back its role on the world stage, taken actions that are undermining efforts to battle the coronavirus pandemic and left the international community without a traditional global leader, according to experts, diplomats and analysts.

item.title: 'Covid toes' may be sign you previously had coronavirus
item.description: Chief Medical Correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta answers viewers questions at CNN's coronavirus town hall.

item.title: Thousands gather for military parade in Belarusian capital, as leader brushes off coronavirus concerns
Little Richard, a flamboyant architect of rock 'n' roll, is dead at 87
item.description: Little Richard, the screaming, preening, scene-stealing wild man of early rock 'n' roll with hits like "Tutti Frutti" and "Long Tall Sally," has died at 87, Dick Alen, his former agent, confirmed to CNN.

item.title: Trump questions whole concept of tests. See Gupta's reaction
item.description: After Vice President Pence's press secretary Katie Miller tested positive for coronavirus, President Trump questioned the "whole concept of tests."

item.title: Why does Bollywood use the offensive practice of brownface in movies?
item.description: Bollywood may be best known for its glamorous casts, glitzy costumes and energetic dance routines. But it also has a far less flattering reputation -- for promoting the offensive practice of brownface.

item.title: Coronavirus leaves the Gulf's migrant workers in limbo, with no income and no easy way out
item.description: Six Indian workers lie in bunk beds in the middle of a workday. Beyond the four walls of their small room in the United Arab Emirates, their options for maintaining a livelihood are becoming increasingly slim.

item.title: US blocks UN resolution on global coronavirus ceasefire after China pushes WHO mention
item.description: The United States blocked agreement Friday on a UN Security Council resolution that called for a global ceasefire aimed at collectively addressing the coronavirus pandemic ravaging the globe, after China pushed for the resolution to mention the World Health Organization.

item.title: Coronavirus has created a rift between the US and China that may take a generation to heal
item.description: The novel coronavirus has destroyed lives and livelihoods in both the United States and China. But instead of bonding the two nations together to fight the pandemic, it has sent their already strained relations on a rapid downward spiral -- and fanned the flames of a potentially dangerous strain of nationalism.

item.title: A record number hold a strong opinion of Trump
item.description: President Donald Trump's campaign is about to unleash a "Death Star" against former Vice President Joe Biden, according to campaign manager Brad Parscale. In any other era with any other president, such imagery might seem out of place. It makes sense for Trump.

item.title: Triple drug therapy helps coronavirus patients recover more quickly, study finds
item.description: A combination of three antiviral drugs plus an immune system booster seemed to help patients recover more quickly from coronavirus infections, doctors in Hong Kong reported Friday.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
Trump won't, or can't, do empathy
item.description: A fresh round of staggering economic numbers came Friday that underscored the deep economic pain that workers are feeling around the country, but President Donald Trump's mind was on a familiar list of grievances: his former Attorney General Jeff Sessions, the perpetrators of the Russia "hoax," the "dirty politicians" and "dirty cops" who wronged him.

item.title: Beaches are going 'business class' this summer
item.description: You make reservations at restaurants, sure. But how about booking in advance just to get a spot on the sand at the beach?

item.title: Cuomo warns of 'different chapter' as 5-year-old dies from Covid-related complications
item.description: For months, parents have been counting their blessings amid reports that the novel coronavirus generally seemed to spare children.

item.title: Roy Horn of animal and magic act Siegfried and Roy dies of Covid-19
item.description: Roy Horn, one-half of the popular Las Vegas animal and magic act Siegfried and Roy, died Friday of complications from the coronavirus, according to his publicist. He was 75.

item.title: Fact-checking five of Trump's false claims this week
item.description: CNN's Daniel Dale fact-checks five of President Donald Trump's claims this week, from falsely saying the Obama administration left him broken coronavirus tests to promising he'll always protect health care plans for people with pre-existing conditions.

item.title: FDA chief self-quarantines after coming in contact with individual who tested positive for coronavirus
item.description: Dr. Stephen Hahn, the head of the Food and Drug Administration, will self-quarantine for 14 days after coming in contact with an individual who tested positive for coronavirus, an FDA spokesman confirmed to CNN.

item.title: Man who recorded the Ahmaud Arbery shooting has been receiving threats, attorney says
Woman body-slammed by off-duty cop in Alabama Walmart grew disorderly after associate asked she wear a mask, police say
item.description: An unidentified woman who was body-slammed by an off-duty police officer in an Alabama Walmart faces multiple charges, police say, in an incident they said may have been sparked over her refusal to wear a mask.

item.title: South Dakota governor tells Sioux tribes they have 48 hours to remove Covid-19 checkpoints
item.description: The governor of South Dakota has given an ultimatum to two Sioux tribes: Remove checkpoints on state and US highways within 48 hours or risk legal action.

item.title: Trump promotes a channel with far-right agitators. And it's not Fox
item.description: On one afternoon in April, Yamiche Alcindor, the White House correspondent for PBS Newshour, grew exasperated.

item.title: Jane Goodall: 'We brought this on ourselves'
item.description: Dr. Jane Goodall, DBE, founder of the Jane Goodall Institute & UN Messenger of Peace, tells Amanpour that humanity's disrespect for nature led to coronavirus.

item.title: Here's when the US job market will recover
item.description: The US job market has completely cratered within mere weeks. And it isn't coming back anytime soon.

item.title: US Army pushing to develop wearable sensors to detect coronavirus symptoms
item.description: The US Army is asking technology companies to develop wearable sensors to detect early symptoms of coronavirus. This week they invited initial proposals for a $25 million contract to develop a device that uses existing technology as much as possible.

item.title: Queen Elizabeth reveals 'one of most memorable nights' in rare interview
item.description: Queen Elizabeth speaks about her experience as a 19-year-old princess celebrating VE day when Nazi troops surrendered to Allied troops ending World War II.

item.title: Nurse accused of stealing, using credit card from her dying Covid-19 patient
item.description: Police say a nurse at a New York City hospital faces charges for stealing a credit card of a former Covid-19 patient while hospitalized, which the patient's daughter says was used for gasoline and groceries.

item.title: New images reveal the heart of Jupiter's storms
item.description: Jupiter is known for its massive storms, but trying to peer inside them requires teamwork by the Juno spacecraft, the Hubble Space Telescope and the ground-based Gemini North telescope in Hawaii. Collective observations from this dream team have produced stunning images and revealed what's happening inside Jupiter's giant, continuous storms.

item.title: Last Nazi message decoded by Britain revealed on VE Day anniversary
item.description: The last recorded Nazi message intercepted and decoded by Britain in World War II has been revealed for the first time to mark the 75th anniversary of Victory in Europe (VE) Day.

item.title: IOC chief: No 'Plan B' for further delay to Tokyo 2020 Games
item.description: The International Olympic Committee [IOC] is proceeding on the basis that the Tokyo Olympics will take place in 2021 with no Plan B for deferring the Games again, according to John Coates, head of the IOC's inspectorate for the Games.

item.title: What is a polar vortex?
item.description: CNN's Jennifer Gray explains what is a "polar vortex" and what to do if you find yourself in very cold temperatures.

item.title: Breaking the cycle of discrimination against Asian Americans
item.description: It's May -- Asian Pacific American Heritage Month -- a time to celebrate and commemorate this vibrant community. That's not happening now, or at least not in the same way. With Covid-19 making it impossible for us to gather in person, organizations are trying to adapt. Film festivals have gone virtual. Theater and music groups are hosting performances from artists' living rooms. Galas are being held as Zoom parties, with links to online auction and donation platforms.

item.title: Gerber's new baby Magnolia is the first adopted spokesbaby in the company's history
item.description: This year's Gerber baby just goes to show that family doesn't have to be defined by genes.

item.title: Diego Maradona autographs shirt to help poor district of Buenos Aires
item.description: Diego Maradona is helping in the fight against coronavirus in his home city by autographing a replica of the Argentina jersey he wore in the country's 1986 World Cup final triumph to raise money for an underprivileged community.

item.title: Top football leagues given option to scrap VAR when competition resumes
item.description: The English Premier League (EPL) and other major football leagues have been given the option to scrap the use of VAR (Video Assistant Referee) when their competitions resume after being halted by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: The plane that's become a Covid-19 hero
item.description: During the week of April 21, there were just two passenger-carrying 747 jumbo jets flying around the world. The Covid-19 pandemic has made the Queen of the Skies an acutely endangered monarch.

item.title: Pandemic parenting advice from a single mom
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has presented many of us with an overwhelming amount of stress — but for a single parent juggling multiple roles, those stresses are even more intensified. Here's how bestselling author and single mom Rachel Simmons gets it done.

item.title: Sharks are also thriving without us around
item.description: It is a now-familiar story: as humans are trapped indoors by the deadly coronavirus, wildlife is taking the opportunity to fill abandoned spaces.

item.title: How 9 artists are living and creating during self-isolation
Business is booming for these 14 companies during the coronavirus pandemic
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has been, to say the least, grim for business. Widespread layoffs and furloughs have prompted about 21% of the US labor force to file for unemployment benefits since mid-March, and economists say the United States is likely already in a recession. And even as states begin to reopen, many of the jobs that have been lost may never come back.

item.title: Malia Obama makes rare appearance in documentary
item.description: Former first daughter Malia Obama makes a rare appearance on Michelle Obama's Netflix documentary, where she gets emotional after seeing the crowd for her mom's book tour.

item.title: Striking aerial photos show human impact on the natural world
item.description: Viewed from above, the Mediterranean's salt farms take the form of abstract paintings. Piles of crystallized salt, which divide the artificial ponds, appear like lines of white paint between blocks of saturated green, red, orange and pink -- colors created by algae and other microorganisms in the shallow seawater.

item.title: South Korea shows life after lockdown is not what people think
Spanish prime minister fails to prove existence of international coronavirus testing rankings he cited
Former VP says US in 'grave danger'
item.description: Former Vice President Al Gore explains what he thinks it means to be a leader during times of crisis, and why he believes President Donald Trump has failed during this pandemic.

item.title: Analysis: How 2 ex-presidents showed what real leadership looks like
item.description: Sometimes you don't know what you've got until it's gone.

item.title: Colorado election official says he felt pressured by state GOP chair to submit incorrect election results
item.description: A dispute over a Colorado state Senate candidate's effort to get on a primary ballot has led a local election official to allege that US Rep. Ken Buck, who also chairs the state's Republican Party, was pressuring him to submit incorrect election results -- and says he has the audio to prove it.

item.title: Coronavirus found in men's semen
item.description: The new coronavirus can persist in men's semen even after they have begun to recover, a finding that raises the possibility the virus could be sexually transmitted, Chinese researchers said Thursday.
